description: Number of distinct values in the list of number of divisors, d(j), j=1...n.
references: B. Spearman and K. S. Williams, Handbook of Estimates in the Theory of Numbers, Carleton Math. Lecture Note Series No. 14, 1975; see p. 2.2.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
P. Erdős and L. Mirsky, The distribution of values of the divisor function d(n), Proc. London Math. Soc. 2 (1952), pp. 257-271.
formula: Erdős & Mirsky show that log a(n) ~ k sqrt(log x)/log log x where k = Pi sqrt(8/3). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 07 2012
author: _Labos Elemer_, May 28 2001
